Speaker: sonya
Dialogue: Princess Anastasia - you're late and it's all my  fault!

Speaker: anastasia
Dialogue: Don't worry, Sonya, no one'll notice. . .

Speaker: anastasia
Dialogue: . . .  owwwwwwwww!

Speaker: ivar
Dialogue: You're a servent! Never forget your place!

Speaker: dmitiri
Dialogue: Someday my place will be out there!

Speaker: ivar
Dialogue: Never! You're a peasant, Dmitri! Back in the kitchen

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Why were you so late tonight

Speaker: anastasia
Dialogue: I was showing Sonya something . . .

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: What were you showing her?

Speaker: anastasia
Dialogue: How to read.

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: I thought you were told not to tutor your servants anymore.

Speaker: anastasia
Dialogue: I know, but I had to because . . .

Speaker: anastasia
Dialogue: Oh, Grandmama, why do you have to go back to Paris?

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: It's where I've made my home but I do have something for you . . .

Speaker: anastasia
Dialogue: "Together in Paris"! Oh, when can we be "together in Paris?!

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: When you're older . . .

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Until then, whenever you hear this song, think of me and know that I'm waiting for you.

Speaker: nicholas
Dialogue: Rasputin!  You're alive . . .

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: Despite being shot, poisoned and thrown into an icy river . . . YES!

Speaker: nicholas
Dialogue: I had nothing to do with it!

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: You gave the orders!

Speaker: nicholas
Dialogue: I did no such thing!

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: After all I've done for your family - YOU TRIED TO KILL MEEEEEE ! ! !

Speaker: anastasia
Dialogue: NO!

Speaker: anastasia
Dialogue: We're not afraid of you!

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: You . . .  my little babushka . . . you'll be so much fun to kill that I'll save you for last!

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: THIS IS THE END OF THE ROMANOV LINE - FOREVER !!!!

Speaker: anastasia
Dialogue: My music mox!

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Anastasia, no!

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Hurry, child!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: No - this way!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Go!

Speaker: anastasia
Dialogue: Hurry, Grandmama!

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Get on! Anastasia, get on!

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Grab my hand!

Speaker: anastasia
Dialogue: Don't let go!

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: ANASTASIA!

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Anya! Anya!

Speaker: phlegmenkof
Dialogue: You can't get away from me now . . .

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Don't touch him.

Speaker: phlegmenkof
Dialogue: You ragged, skinny, little nothing!  I have had just about enough of you . . .

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: About as bad as you smell!

Speaker: serebreakov
Dialogue: I want her.

Speaker: phlegmenkof
Dialogue: That's horrible, skinny thing?! She's crazy - she has no memory of anything before she came here! She didn't even know her name! That one is a rotten troublemaker, willful. . .

Speaker: serebreakov
Dialogue: I'll break her will. . .  You will enjoy serving under me.

Speaker: phlegmenkof
Dialogue: I couldn't break you - but he can!

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Anya?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: No.  I'm running to.

Speaker: little girl
Dialogue: Running to? Running to what?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: To find my home.

Speaker: chubby girl
Dialogue: But you are home.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: No. This isn't a home - it's just a building. Home is where you belong and none of us belong here.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Where is your home, Anya?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I'm not sure but look. . .

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: It says "Together in Paris". I was wearing this when I came here ten years ago - it's the only way that I know . . .

Speaker: chubby girl
Dialogue: Is your home in Paris?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: It might be. I have to go and find out.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I have to go now, before it gets light.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: But what if we can't ever find where we came from?!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Then you'll have to make your own home. Lots of people do.

Speaker: gregor
Dialogue: Anya! What if we can't find anyone who loves us?!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Then come find me.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I think you should be more careful about who you invite to dinner!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Could someone tell me. . .

Speaker: peasant 1
Dialogue: End of the line!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Which line?

Speaker: peasant 2
Dialogue: Any line.

Speaker: peasant 3
Dialogue: All lines are good lines.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Very good. . .

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Is this the right line to get papers to travel?

Speaker: peasant 4
Dialogue: Travel? Travel to where?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: To Paris. I have to get to Paris

Speaker: peasant 5
Dialogue: Paris?!  What do they have in Paris that they don't have here?

Speaker: peasant 6
Dialogue: Shorter lines?!

Speaker: peasant 7
Dialogue: Nobody leaves Soviet Russia.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Is this where I get traveling papers?

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: It would be if we let you travel which we  don't so it isn't.  Russia is the people's paradise!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I didn't

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Dmitri? There must be a million Dmitris. . .

Speaker: peasant 9
Dialogue: Which line is this?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Excuse me, do you know Dmitri. . .

Speaker: peasant 9
Dialogue: I know nothing!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I wish they'd all stop telling me they didn't tell me!

Speaker: tiny husband
Dialogue: Could you get rid of her moustache?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Excuse me - I'm looking for a man named Dmitri. . .

Speaker: artist
Dialogue: But I didn't write it.

Speaker: dissolve to
Dialogue: A SIGN

Speaker: actress 1
Dialogue: Oh, Grandmama! It's me, Anastasia! I've waited so long to see you!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Vladimir, calm down!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: For a ten million rubles reward we can look a little longer. This is the big one. . .  and all I need is the right girl.

Speaker: actress 2
Dialogue: Oh, Grandmama! It's me, Anastasia. I've waited so long to see you.

Speaker: actress 3
Dialogue: See you!

Speaker: actress 4
Dialogue: Oh. . . Grandmama. . .  It's me. . .

Speaker: actress 5
Dialogue: Oh, Grandmama. . .

Speaker: actress 6
Dialogue: What's my modivation?

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Stanislavski!

Speaker: actress 7
Dialogue: Oh. . .

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: I've gotta find the right girl!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Next.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: It's no use, Dmitri - we'll never find the right girl!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: We will.  We have to.  Come on, Vlad - she's out there.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: She could be right under our nose

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Ouch!  That really hurt!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I'm sorry. . .  I'm. . .

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: That's quite a hard head you've got there, boy.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I'm looking for Dmitri.  I need traveling papers - to Paris. I heard Dmitri could help me.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Who did you hear it from?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I heard it from everyone who said I didn't hear it from them!   Do you know Dmitri?

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: I know Dmitri well - perhaps I can help you.  Providded you have enough money to pay for this service. . .

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Well, I don't have any money . . .

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Good day!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I have a bike!  Perhaps I could sell it and. . .

Speaker: policeman
Dialogue: Nonsense.  There is no crime in the Soviet Socialist Republic.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Sorry, boy, I have to go.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: . . .  even if we find her, what makes you think the Empress will even see us?

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: She'll see us.

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: You, uhh. . .  hang here often?  "Hang" get it?  I said "hang" and we're both, you know, cause we're bats. . .  and, uhhh. . . what's your sign?

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: What was that?

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: That was your dinner!  I do hope there is no cabbage in Paris!

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Whatta' ya say we go somewhere - maybe get a bug to eat.  Get it?  A "bug" to eat, 'cause we're. . .

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: What are you do. . .

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: DANCING BEARS, PAINTED WINGS THINGS I ALMOST REMEMBER. AND A SONG SOMEONE SINGS ONCE UPON A DECEMBER

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: You're trespassing, boy!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I. . .  I. . .  spoke to you earlier about traveling paper. .

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: It's her.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: He's her?

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Look!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Are you Dmitri?  I didn't  mean to trespass - I don't want to do anything dishonest, but if you could just help help me. . .

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Perhaps you heard of our brilliant plan to find a girl and. . .

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: She doesn't want to do anything "dishonest". . .

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Ew. . .  the honest type.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: You look like her.  Like the Princess Anastasia.  Has anyone ever told you that before?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Oh, yeah - in the orphanage they constantly told me I looked like a princess! Stop that!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: People say Anastasia was the only member of the Royal Family to escape alive.  That makes her an orphan too

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I don't know - I don't remember anything that happened before the revolution. . .

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: You know, it's strange - Anastasia's grandmother, the Dowager Empress Tatiana has been looking for Anastasia since the revolution.  Why do you think she wouldn't go to her own grandmother?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I don't know.  I don't see what this has to do with me.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Perhaps it's because she has amnesia too - can't remember. . .

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: How much do you weigh?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Look, I came here to get papers to travel to Paris and. . .

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Why do you want to go to Paris?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I have my reasons.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Anastasia's grandmother is in Paris.  We're going to bring Anastasia to her - in Paris.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Look - there isn't an orphan in the world who doesn't dream she's a princess but, come on. . .  Look at me!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: NO!  YOU LOOK AT HER!  LOOK AT HER!  It could be you.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: THINGS MY HEART USED TO KNOW THINGS IT YEARNS TO REMEMBER. . .

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Find out the truth - come to Paris with us.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: All right.  I will go with you.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: The Her Royal Highness Princess Anastasia!

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Oy. . .  he's gonna be so mad. . .

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: THINGS MY HEART USED TO KNOW THINGS IT YEARNS TO REMEMBER ...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Find out the truth - come to Paris with us.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: All right. I will go with you.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: The Her Royal Highness Princess Anastasia!

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Oy. . .  he's gonna be so mad...

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Ummm ... Father Gregori? It's, uhh ... me. Bartok.  Phew! Not home ...

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Oh my God!  Don't do that ... feel my heart. Go ahead. I'm dying here ...

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: And what do you want, my little rat-with-wings?

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Name calling! That's mature.

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: I gave you that tongue and I can rip it out!

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Oyyyy... Okay, now... promise you won't get angry.

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: Why would I ever be angry with you, little friend?

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Yeah, right. Keep that thought okay? So, I'm in town, stop by the old palace. You get a better class of bats there - no tattoos or anything.

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: Get to the point sometime tonight.. I'm late for a wenching.

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Okay... you're not gonna like this but, well, it looks like Anastasia is ... still alive.

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: Impossible. That rumor's been around for years.

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Trust me, it's her!

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: How do you know?

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Rodent's intuition, how do I know? She looks exactly like her. Except she's taller, which    is natural ... Of course my second cousin Treplev - he never    grew. Looks like a little pepper shaker. He was so cute ...

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: Source of my power. Owner of my soul. I need your help.

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Hey, she's just a kid. And she's going to Paris outta sight, outta mind, outta Russia.

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: I cursed then all!

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: My Aunt Bella, sweet woman not the brightest bat in the world - she used to hang right side up, anyway she always said "Curses were made to be broken". Course, she said it in those irritating little bat squeaks, so it wasn't quite so profound...

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: The Romanovs tried to kill me and I swore to destroy all of them! If she lives, if she should have a child someday, the Romanov Family continues! And I won't lot that happen! THIS IS THE END OF THE LINE!

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: You know, this is really obsessive behavior. There is this doctor this doctor in Austria, Sigmund something and he feels. . .

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: YOU IDIOT

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: Do you have any idea what would happen if that broke?!

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: You'd lose your security deposit?

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: Evil, powerful beings - I have their power only if I contain them, control them. If they should all be released at once... well ...

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Ohhh, that was dumb...

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: Finish my prophecy...

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Ew, I hate when he does this!

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: She is not to get off that train... alive!

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: Go! I don't care what you do with the others but finish the girl! KILLLLL HERRRRR!  And have fun...

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Take her away, Sophie.

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Haven't anything better to do than to break my heart.

Speaker: sophie
Dialogue: Oh, oh... I must say. I thought that one was bar - i'm just so shocked that she wasn't real well, she was real, I mean she was human, of course. but not our real. I must say, even my sisters were touched by her yes - yes they were...

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: No, Sophie. My heart can't take it anymore! I will see no more girls claiming to be Anastasia.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Hurry up with those papers.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Would you have leaned over Rembrant's shoulder and told him to paint faster?

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: "Wake up, your highness" - we should start getting used to saying it.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: What a world - a man who was in my position in society is calling a peasant 'Your Highness".

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Wake up!

Speaker: vladimer
Dialogue: We have a lot of work to do...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Come on!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Take my hand!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Do you always punch people first thing in the morning?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Sorry - it's a reflex. Living in an orphanage if someone bothers you - you automatically come up swinging.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: I wasn't bothering you. I was trying to wake you up!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: By pulling my hair?!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: I was all out of dynamite!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Put it on your nose. For heaven's sake, you're making such a fuss!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Men are such babies...

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Here, let me

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: You're a princess...

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Royalty do not help people with their luggage.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Well, she certainly has a mind of her own.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Yes. And I hate that in a woman.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Papers!

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: It's what I hate about this government - everything in red!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Thank you, Comrade Zhivago.

Speaker: zhivago
Dialogue: Doctor Zhivago.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: What do we do now?

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Pray he's color-blind...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: wait here.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I'm going to stretch my legs

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: That's a good idea - a great idea - stretch your legs  ... stretch then that way.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I must have hit him harder than I thought...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: That's them! Come on!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Wait here!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Would you like to tell what we are...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Come on up!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Just what do you think you're doing?!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Trying... to... breathe...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: The guards!  I'll explain later.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Forged papers! Now, what?!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Now just get off the train.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: HUH?!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Noooo....

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: She's quite right, Dmitri, a man of my stature should not have to

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Come on, we'll jump together... Take my hand.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Come on!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: I think I have hurt my...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: You must enjoy causing me pain!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: You shouldn't have pushed us!

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Is everyone all right?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I'm fine.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: She's fine!  I may never walk right again, but she's fine...

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Well, I better got goin'. Got a busy day letting all the blood rush to my head...

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: She's too far away, isn't she?

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Oy... not a road trip. I get wagon sick, you know that.

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: We'll catch her and finish her!  We ride this night!

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Well,    we wait this night!

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: No have a lot of work to do, Anya! Come along, Meetoo!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Who's Sophie?

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Ah ... the Lady Sophie... The ravishing first cousin, once removed, from the Empress. We must convince Sophie that you are the Princess before we'll be granted a meeting with the Empress ... your grandmother, I mean.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: What?!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: You are the Princess.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: We're just going to refresh your memory...

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I don't have a memory and I'm not a Princess!  Even if I were - no one's ever going to believe it. I'm not exactly...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: What do you see?

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Ah! Let us begin!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: ...and on my father's side, there was [THIS SECTION IS NOT LEDGABLE]

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Every Russian family has one..

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Natasha! Natasha Feastavich!- but we called her Nashie Fooshie!

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Did I tell you that?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: You must have.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: [THIS SECTION ALSO NOT LEDGABLE]

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: It's the best fork of all

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: The dessert fork!

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Ah, yes ... I have always loved that fork...

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: What a beautiful ship!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: It used to be a private yacht before the government took it over.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Oh, yes it was the seagoing vessel of elaborate elegance in entertaining...  A party boat. It once belonged to ...

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Konstantin Petrovich of Moscow!

Speaker: elderly dowager
Dialogue: No, no, boys! You don't know where he's been!

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Come out! I can do alterations.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: I shant!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: I won't laugh - I swear...

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: You said you wouldn't laugh!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: It's not you - it's the dress!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I'm never going to be..

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: You are a natural! I don't know how you ever learned to dance that well! That must have been some high class orphanage ...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: I wanted to show you something.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: It's so beautiful ... and sad.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Sad?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Lost. it feels lost. This was hers?

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Yeah ... well, yours. You still don't believe that you're the Princess, do you?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I know I must have had something to do with the palace - I've had little flashes of things - but being the Princess? It doesn't matter as long as I find my home.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Well, the only thing you've got when you've got a home is a fear of losing it! You're lucky you don't remember the revolution -- I never had much, but what I did have -- I lost.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Hey! It doesn't matter! You gotta make your own way in the world! Don't be sorry for me! I'm going to get what I want don't you worry!

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: She's out there ...

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: I'm getting a chest cold..

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: Bartok... a question.

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: I'm getting pneumonia. I have a fever. Feel my forehead...

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: What do you think is the most humiliating way to die?

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: My cousin Mischa, nice fellow had some dental problems - you didn't want to watch him eat, let's put it that way...

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: ... anyway, a bunch of other bats were hanging in the belfry - I know, cliche, but there you have it, and Mischa, not the brightest bat in the world, decides to hang in the bell. Which was fine for awhile until it started ringing ...  Ewwww, what a mess ...

Speaker: rasputtn
Dialogue: Show her to me ...

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: And it didn't help the tonal quality of the bell, either.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: If you have to go - wake her..

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: What were you doing?!

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Boy, don't you hate it when that happens?

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: She leads a charmed life, that little one ... Someone is always there to save her. In the palace as a child, on the train and now ... it's him.

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Nice looking fellow. I mean, don't get me wrong - I'm not attracted to him in the physical sense, I just ...

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: You are toying with me, aren't you? You let me get so close...

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Me? No. Rich food - it kills me. Ever try and fly after one of those heavy sauces?

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: We are going to Paris - and while we're there, let's kill the young man. He annoys me.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Oh! I'm sorry...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: It's okay. Didn't hurt..

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I'm almost there... I'm finally going to know...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: How is our current financial status?

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: If I used the word "bleak" I would be optimistic.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: It worked in Odessa...

Speaker: elderly dowager
Dialogue: Help! My little dogs! Chevalier! Maurice! Hold on, darlings!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: I'll save them, Madame

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Such bravery! Why, that man should be rewarded! Amply rewarded!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: That was really very kind of you.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: I won't say a word...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Nervous?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Yes - If I can't convince Sophie, I'll never be able to see Tatiana....

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: You'll convince her. You have the qualities of a princess you're poised and strong... and beautiful ... even if you forget a couple dates of family names - she'll know.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: May I present her Royal Highness Princess Anastasia!

Speaker: sophie
Dialogue: Oh good! We haven't seen an Anastasia in several days!

Speaker: sophie
Dialogue: I'd just like to ask you a few questions, dear...

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: sophie
Dialogue: Where were you born?

Speaker: sophie
Dialogue: This is the hard one ... what rare treat was served on the night of the Three Hundredth Anniversary of the Romanov Dynasty? The last ball they ever had?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Father had fresh tropical fruits sent in. Oranges and pineapples from the far east. I remember ... I remember I threw an orange to a young boy who was hiding under a table...

Speaker: sophie
Dialogue: Yes ... yes, it was fresh fruit. Well, maybe not "fresh" Estelle got one rather brown banana but ...

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Are you impressed with our Anastasia?

Speaker: sophie
Dialogue: Oh, heavens - I must say, yes.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Then, you'll take her to see Tatiana?

Speaker: sophie
Dialogue: Oh, heavens I must say... no, no actually, I can't - Tatiana has refused to see any more girls.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Perhaps you could convince her?

Speaker: sophie
Dialogue: Oh, heavens, no... but ...  She is going to be at the Ballet Russe tonight! That's the Russian Ballet - Russe for Russian, oh those crazy French... they only go to see which dancers will defect.

Speaker: sophie
Dialogue: Come my dear, we've much to talk about.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: We did it! We did it, my boy! We're going to see Tatiana at the ballet tonight and we're going to be rich! Rich!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: But it's not    the money, Vlad.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Are you feeling all right?

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Life is funny, isn't it. You find the right girl ... and then you lose her.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Dmitri ... You must understand that once you take her to Tatiana... well, it's over... nothing can happen between you. She's a princess and you're a commoner.

Speaker: accordion player
Dialogue: Lovers!

Speaker: flower seller
Dialogue: Ooh la la!

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: PARSE HOLDS THE KEY TO MY HEART FRENCH- BAT- CHICKS HANG OUT AT MONTMARTRE WE'LL EAT SOME IN-SECTS THEN GO BACK AND HAVE --

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Sorry, it's just... you know I saw these french postcards once and... ooh la la ... well, I'm not sure about the "ooh", but it's the "la la" I'm really lookin' forward to...  Right, I'm shutting up.

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: We're close to her, aren't we?

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: What do you think? Is it me?

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Compliments of Sophie. Her escort has to look his best.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: How do I look?

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Look. There is your grandmother...

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: She's so beautiful! I do remember her ... I remember her ...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Come on. It's time..

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I'm so scared...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Don't be

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: I need to speak with the Dowager Empress ...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Please, if you'd just listen...

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Remove him at once.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Please! Empress! It's not what you ....

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Anya. . . please. . .

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Anya, wait!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Tell me it isn't true?! Tell me you didn't do this for the money!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: No! Well, yes, but

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: No! I thought you believed in me! It was all a lie!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Sir! Your rear tire is flat!

Speaker: chauffeur
Dialogue: it is?

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Ulo! Slow down!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: I'm not Ulo and I won't slow down. But you will listen to me!

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: You! How dare you?! Stop this car immediately!

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Stop this car!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Please don't be afraid! I'm sorry, but there was no other way!

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Anastasia's music box... She had this all these years...  You could have found it...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: What I foundyour was your granddaughter!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Go away!

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Who are you, child?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I don't know! I don't want to hurt you...

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Do you remember this?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I remember something lost ... I'm so confused! Oh, please, just tell me if you recognize me! Do you think I could have... belonged to you ...

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Oh! Where did you get that?!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I've always had it... I came here because of this! Tell me if you recognize it! Please! It's all I have...

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: If this is part of your scheme! If you found it or stole - I don't care, I'll give you whatever you want just TELL ME THE TRUTH!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: THINGS MY HEAR USED TO KNOW THINGS IT YEARS TO REMEMBER

Speaker: both
Dialogue: AND A SONG SOMEONE SINGS ONCE UPON A DECEMBER...

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: He is gonna yellllll.

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: I should have been a dentist ...

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: ... and that Christmas dinner, when Cook made that awful plum pudding and we hid it in our pockets so we wouldn't hurt her feelings! I do remember so much now, Grandmama, - but not everything.

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Don't worry about that now, child, it will all come back to you now that you're home...

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: Yesss ... finally "home". And what a charming ... girlish little home it is.  Look, Bartok, little angels, the symbol of ... love. So sweet, so harmless.

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Anastasia! It was just a bat! It's gone, dear...

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: No, it wasn't a bat! I saw this horrible man - I remember him, I think...

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: No, no child... shush... it's all right ...

Speaker: sophie
Dialogue: A grand ball for the Princess. How very exciting. So much to do, so little time...

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Do it somewhere else, please. Quietly.

Speaker: sophie
Dialogue: Caterers ... invitations ... saber dancers! We must have saber dancers!

Speaker: pierre
Dialogue: Her head it is ... how you say?

Speaker: andre
Dialogue: Beeg. Zat is how you say it. Beeg.

Speaker: pierre
Dialogue: And the crown she is ... how you say?

Speaker: andre
Dialogue: Small! Zat is "how you say" it! Don't be so French, Pierre wit the "how you say" all za time - zat is really annoying.

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: You are going to make a beautiful princess.

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Lovely...  What troubles you, child?

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Madame, your... eh... guest has arrived.

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Thank you, Vladimir.,

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Anya... Anastasia... I'm sorry ... We didn't mean to hurt you ...

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: I sent for you because I owe you a debt of gratitude larger than I can ever repay

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: No. Empress, you --

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: I want you to have the reward money - you've earned it.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Empress, no! I will not take the money! I just came to tell you I was sorry...

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Young    man, I...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: ... and I'm going to keep my promise to stay out of your lives, forever.

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: You are the boy ...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: I should go

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: That last night in the palace... one boy showed us kindness and courage. You were the boy who saved our lives, weren't you?  Please, is there nothing I can do to repay you?

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Promise me she'll have her home.

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: She does.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: And tell me that she's happy.

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Oh, Dmitri.I wish that I could.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: I'm glad you found what you were looking for.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I'm glad you    did too.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Enjoy your fortune.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: But this invitation came from the Empress herself! It's the social event of the decade! You can't turn it down!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Watch me.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: So where will you go?

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: She found her home. Maybe it's time I found one too!

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: So. You don't want to go to the coronation, eh?

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Rasputin!

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: I know, I know ... you thought I was dead. That's how the history books will remember me - not as the ruler of all of Russia, which I SHOULD HAVE BEEN - but as the guy who was never dead when you expected him to be.

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: What do you want?!

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: The same thing I wanted ten years ago - all the Romonovs dead I got the others, now I have to finish up with that nuisance, Anastasia...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: You're insane! You didn't kill the Romonovs - it was the...

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: STOP IT! I DID SO KILL THEM! And I'm going to kill Anastasia.

Speaker: major domo
Dialogue: ... then as I say "Her Serene Highness Princess Anastasia" you, your Highness, should walk out on to the stage and greet your ...

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: I believe her highness understands what she has to do.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Oh, yes, Grandmama - I wait until I hear...

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: No, not about the ceremony, Anastasia - do you understand the choice you must make.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: There's no choice...

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Your "guest" is unable to attend.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Oh, Meetoo! You look miserable! Oh, Vlad - look at him!

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Yes, your highness.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Poor Meetoo!

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: Yes, your highness.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Cut it out, Vlad! I'm not angry with you anymore - I know how much you needed the money.

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: But they didn't take the money - either one of them. I offered it to them, but they both refused.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Dmitri didn't want the money?

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: No, he just wanted to know you were happy.

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: With your highness, permission.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Vlad, stop acting this way! You're my friend!

Speaker: vladimir
Dialogue: No. From now on I am your loyal subject ... your highness. By your leave?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Why does everyone have to act that way?

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: You'll have to become used to it, child, if you accept the crown...

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: "If" I accept?! Of course I'm going to accept! it's what I always wanted!

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Is it? Is this what you want?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I wanted to come home, Grandmama - and I did. I came back to my home with you.

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: You can't go back to find your home. Your home is in your heart, in the future that you make for yourself.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: And this is my future. This is who I am!

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: This is who you were. Exactly who you are is up to you.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I don't know who I am! I still don't know!

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: Yes, you do. You do.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I've spent my whole life waiting to find you ...

Speaker: tatiana
Dialogue: And we have found each other nothing will ever change that! I am your family, dear child, but I may not be your home.

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: Look, Bartok. Most of them were there the night I made this curse. Now, they'll get to see it finished!  Revenge is a dish best served... in front of a larrrrrge audience!

Speaker: bartok
Dialogue: Ahh, very witty. There's this English guy - Noel Coward - I'll bet he's quaking ...

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Dmitri?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Dmitri ... Grandmama told me.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Dmitri, what's wrong?

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: Throw her off the edge! Do it!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Dmitri ... Look at me! It's Anya! It's ANYA!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: You saved my life in the palace! You won't take it now...

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: FINISH HER!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Dmitri. I know you would never hurt me. You love me.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Dmitri?

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Anya... where are we?

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I guess you aren't as powerful as you thought!

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: I'll show you!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Run, Anya -  go...

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I'm not leaving you!

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: Fighting for fair lady. How noble...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Anya!

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: My curse is now complete! Good-bye, babushka!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Take my hand!  Hurry!

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: Don't let me go!

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: I'll never let go!

Speaker: rasputin
Dialogue: This little piggy had a palace... this little piggy had a throne...

Speaker: dmitri
Dialogue: Come on... I'll take you home.

Speaker: anya
Dialogue: I am home.
